content: Great app for setting problems on our home wall! Better than several others. Interface is easy to use, and it's great to be able to be very specific about holds (especially for a home wall). Thanks for making it! A few suggestions: 1) I don't see a way to sort problems by grade or search for a range of grades. I only see a way to search for a specific grade. This would be a nice feature. 2) as another user suggested, an offline mode would be amazing. When WiFi is bad the app struggles.
replyContent:
Hi Brandon,
thank you very much for your feedback.
Searching for a range of grades is on my list but the offline feature is unfortunately quite hard to implement with the basis of the current app so this is not planned yet.

content: I found it awkward to use
replyContent:
It's a pity to hear that.
If you need help just send me an email to support[at]boulder-challenge.com

content: Pretty nice, some extra suggested features: Make it easy to reuse a photo! I should be able to reuse a photo already on the app, if seeing a route for the same boulder, this should definitely be possible. A free version where you can only (say) access one wall. I have a home build, I'm considering using this for logging all my problems. But it's not reasonable for me to ask all my friends to pay, so I'm considering something else. But this app is so close to perfect :)
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback. Template pics which can be reused are the high priority feature at the moment. So stay tuned for that. It will come soon! 
In total I don't earn money with the app and use the small income to pay the backend server and development fees for the app stores. So I want to use my spare time to add features without limitations ;)

content: I like this, it's easy to use, but another vote for an offline mode or even a batch update feature. The fact that it needs to be connected all of the time and it constantly sends information even when defining a hold on a route essentially makes it unusable in my limited connectivity garage. I wanted this to be what I was looking for, but it's not usable for me in its current build. Cool concept, but I really suggest making some accommodations for users with bad or no connections.
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback.
Unfortunately an offline mode won't be available in the near future because it needs too many changes right now. The data is loaded only when needed. And only the data which is needed for the current task is loaded.
To define a hold no connection is needed, but to initialize the editor and to finally save the boulder.

content: The app seems to work really well in general although it's a little confusing on my home board which uses 'screw ons for feet' rules which is common on system boards. Could we have a simplified marker for just right and left hand with no indicator for feet? This would be easier to read where feet aren't defined.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback!
I put the info "feet only screw ons" in the description of the boulder and don't define any foot holds. Or if this is common practice at a wall I just define only hand holds and no feet. It's up to you how detailed you specify your boulder and feet indication is totally optional. But can be used if needed.

content: Great app for recording all the problems for my homeboard!
replyContent: Thank you very much for the good feedback.

content: The best app for those lucky enough to have their own wall at home!
replyContent:
Thank you very much, I appreciate it.
Be lucky, have fun :)

content: Best app for recording, building and sharing climbing problems that is available in my opinion. Very versatile and easy to use with innovative updates regularly. 5 stars
replyContent: Thanks a lot. Next update with new features will be available in the next days ;)

content: I have been using this app for a few months now, and compared to other apps, this is so much easier to use. The ability to designate holds between left/right, hand/foot is a great feature. My only complaint is the lack of offline capability. Suggestion: be able to download problems from favorite boulders section. Thank you.
replyContent:
Thanks a lot for your great feedback.
The offline functionality is already on my todo list but it doesn't have the highest priority at the moment because there are many more useful features on the list and the offline capability needs a lot of changes.
Stay healthy and have fun!

content: dark mode would be 5/5 and I would prefer of I could swipe to change pages instead of tappig
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback and suggestions.

content: Just got it! It would be helpful, if looking at a gyms boulder list, to see some indication of which boulders I have ticked already and even sort by that. Maybe the name could change color or something once I have climbed it? I had Open Climb, but after a while it becomes a blur of what has been climbed and what hasn't. This is much better than that I think, but I'd still like to be able to sort if that's any easy fix?
replyContent:
Thanks a lot for your feedback. This is already on my todo list and I think I will integrate such a functionality soon.

But first the next release will give you the option to mark and filter boulders as not existent anymore which is helpful after resetting the wall. Maybe after that ;)

content: Just installed the app and I'm already loving it! I have a tiny woodie in my cellar with tons of projects that can never remember, especially the circuits. I've tried everything but so far all the methods have been too time consuming. Boulder Challenge is a life saver. Thank you!
replyContent:
Thanks for your feedback. I'm very happy that it's such useful for you.
In the future it's planned to optionally add numbering to the markers which is really helpful for ciruits ;)

content: Great app, works perfectly for our little coop gym.
replyContent: Thanks a lot and for the feedback via email as well.

content: Great app. Perfect for my home wall. Easy to define and share problems. Developer is open and responsive to fixing any bugs.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for the feedback and also for the feature request.

content: Great app with great updates. Allows collecting and sharing of problems by others who use the wall with intuitive controls and interface. Excited to see what other updates will come.
replyContent:
Thanks a lot, Kian!
The list of planned features is long. I think the next thing will be to extend the boulder editor, for example optional numbering of the marks and more...
On the long run there will also kind of a log book added, so stay tuned ;)

content: Testing it out, seems like a great option for people with home gyms!
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. Hope the app works well for you. Have fun!
